intro: Thlaspi chalepense, commonly known as wall penny-cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial species characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically thrives in rocky or disturbed soils and is often found in temperate regions. Its seeds are small and contain a high oil content, which has been historically used in various traditional applications. Thlaspi chalepense is also noted for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
